### What is it
Evcoap aims at providing a fully compliant implementation of the [CoAP protocol](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-core-coap), of its discovery companion [Link-Format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6690), and of the pretty useful [Observe](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-core-observe) and [Block](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-core-block) options.

Evcoap is based on [Libevent 2.x](http://libevent.org) by Niels Provos and Nick Mathewson, and shares much of the design philosophy found in its evhttp front-end.

### Goal
Our final goal is to give libevent users a robust set of tools for creating compliant CoAP-based applications including, but not limited to, [HTTP-CoAP interworking proxies](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-castellani-core-http-mapping), [Resource Directories](http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-shelby-core-resource-directory), etc., that can equally run on UNIX, Mac and Windows systems.

### Project Documentation
In a not so distant future you will hopefully find design documentation on the [wiki](https://github.com/babongo/evcoap/wiki) pages.

### Authors and Contributors
Founding project members are @yrz, @salvatoreloreto, and @babongo.
